result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quintin William Essex

records.addlTxt:
8:56 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Quintin William Essex in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt appeared by video for Quintin William Essex.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Court states DE has SEHR on another matter and sets PSC. Atty Schmidt requests no contact be amended to no abusive contact and references letter previously filed to case. ADA Rockow objects to modification and states no DV assessment completed. Court would like DV assessment completed and denies bond modification request at this time. Adjourned at 8:58 AM.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Request to be released. Filed by DE. arc    Per RMW on 08/29/22. DENIED

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Makayla W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:14 PM CO: TCH , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Ali Casey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Quintin William Essex appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Enter NG. Waives speedy trial. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned
Settlement conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
